title: What is the amount and compound interest on Rs. 10,000 for 3 years at 2% per annum? - Quora

response.answer_text: Asking these type of question reminds me of, a student in our class who just to pretend that he understand everything the teacher teaches us in class; ask silly questions. Anyways for your question i have more than 3 methods to solve and more or less all are same method but technique used seems different. Method I: Compound Interest = = [P (1 + i)^n] – P P=10000 n=3 Years i=2 % per annum Therefore; {10000(1+2%)^3}-10000 Or 10000(102/100)^3 - 10000 Or 10000(51/50)^3 - 10000 Or 10612.08 - 10000 = 612.08 Amount = 10612.08 Method 2: R= 2% Find the ratio proportion of it i.e 2/100 or 1/50 if 50 is principal then 1 is Interest.
